result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Davis

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:22am 
Defendant Christopher L Davis in court with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rumpf indicates that the Defense is still awaiting additional discovery. Attorney Rump has requested some discovery that the State says they are not in possession of, so ADA Shock is contacting the law enforcement agency to determine if such discovery exists; the scheduling of another status conference is requested.
recess 10:25am

NEXT:  Status Conference on November 18th at 11:00am

Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] case called at 8:38am
Defendant Christopher L Davis in court with Attorney Amber Rumpf. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Officer R. Walters- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Rumpf
Arguments are given.
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Davis committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:53am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on September 28th at 3:00pm,  (2) Status Conference on October 20th at 9:30am
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/16) ML
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/16) ML
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JAs Review of 7/27/22 RUMS
JAs Review of 7/27/22 RUMS

[MK] case called at 1:22pm.
Defendant Christopher L Davis not in court.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing and the State's officer-witness is present. 
Attorney Rumpf does not have information about the non-appearances, however she notes that Mr. Davis did come on the last hearing date to the Courthouse however he was late and said he is on electronic monitoring 
ADA Beck indicates the State has some information, that Mr. Davis is on a jail diversion program; he is on electronic monitoring and would be appearing on his own for today's hearing. 
The Court orders the issuance of a Warrant for Mr. Davis- Body only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.  
The Court finds the Bond to be in default
recess 1:26pm, reconvene 1:58pm. Defendant Christopher L Davis now appears. 
Attorney Rumpf indicates that Mr. Davis mis-understood the hearing time to be 1:30pm. He arrived at approximately 1:45pm. 
Arguments are given on bond.  
The Court admonishes Mr. Davis to appear timely for further court hearings.  
The Court cancels the warrant-authorization. The Court reinstates the (already-posted) $500 Cash Bond and conditions. 
recess 2:03pm.

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on September 8th at 8:30am
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/7/28/22)
certified copy to DA (7/19/22--ma)
to Produce
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 11:06am [Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing]
Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears.  Michael C. Witt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher L Davis does NOT appear. 

Atty Rumpf informs the Court that she just learned that Mr. Davis is serving a sentence in Dane County. 

The Court tolls time limits, finds good cause. 

recess: 11:08am 
NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 7/28/22 at 1:00pm IN PERSON (State to prepare writ)

Order to Seal Victim Key

--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription

[ma] Case called at 2:08 PM 
Defendant Christopher L Davis appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth; updates address to 6805 Century Ave. Middleton, 53562
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of Atty Rumpf. 

The Court requires a $500 CASH bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 2:12  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 7/15/22 at 11:00am
